column15: Please share your feedback about this task -- How can this task be improved? Did you face any problem? Was some instruction vague? Were some tweets difficult to understand?

column3: Allergic reactions can be triggered by ANYTHING!! it's common sense that the vaccine is going to trigger an allergic reaction in a small number of the population
column4: How do you think modern medicine exists?? You have to introduce the virus sometimes to ensure you acquire immunity against it
column5: Each vaccine has it's benefits, depending on the virus you are vaccinating for
column6: The vaccines can significantly reduce the risk of catching/ infecting / dying from the virus
column7: Whilst you can't cover every variant, if the vaccine can protect and save lives for some then surely it's worth it?
column8: Fact - knowledge about vaccines are forever evolving and recommendations will change accordingly
column9: Sadly young people are not immune from the virus - covid doesn't discriminate against age. If you can reduce your risk of serious illness then why not
column10: good for you, positive attitude that you're embracing Chinese vaccines
column11: Perhaps the vaccine might just save your life though??
column12: Perhaps the 3 billionaires could share some of their wealth with the population then
column13: Do you know anything about vaccines at all?? some are live vaccines whilst others are synthetically produced
column14: How is pushing a vaccine siding with China?? it's about protecting world health!!
column15: Overall the tweets were easy to understand

column3: How rare? How many people will get those? As opposed to how many of those people could die from COVID given they have rare genes responsible for allergic reactions? Think about it.
column4: I think it is an interesting point, did you read it on reddit? I'd like to give some further proof of these aborted baby cells. But even then, chimpanzees and aborted babies are close to humans, and many of the vaccines/meds that you normally take for a plain flu contain the same stuff.
column5: I completely agree with you, I have personally received AZ and only then found out about dangers for people of my age. I think it was more of a panic in the very beginning, there are now some really good sources of finding out which vaccine would be most appropriate for you: https://www.yalemedicine.org/news/covid-19-vaccine-comparison
column6: It doesn't stop you, but it significantly reduces the chances. If you had a 100% chance of dying from cancer with no chemo or a 50% chance to survive with, what would you choose?
column7: it's a fair point, but the vaccine and antibodies in our bodies are also adapting to changes. Having no antibodies at all puts you more at risk rather than having an additional chance of being protected WITH the vaccine.
column8: When the vaccines first came out, we were all in a bit of a rush and panic to end the pandemic ASAP. I trust more recent research a lot more these days, since it's literally been YEARS worth of research. these things make a lot more sense now, just look up research you trust.
column9: Covid is not as scary for young people and there were far fewer deaths indeed (https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/healthandsocialcare/causesofdeath/articles/covid19vaccinationandmortalityinyoungpeopleduringthecoronaviruspandemic/2022-03-22), but it does not mean there were NO deaths. If you compare stats of vaccine side effects vs probability of dying from COVID, the latter is scarier.
column10: Most of the things that you 'take' or 'use' are Chinese-made :) It has been long standing stereotype that things made in China are of a lower quality, but in this case it has proven to be wrong, as it is as effective and China have not had many cases for a very long time now. https://news.google.com/covid19/map?hl=en-GB&mid=/m/0fbp0&gl=GB&ceid=GB:en
column11: I would have to argue with both of these here. It may not be 'fancy' and 'well-known' as other cars, but there are no safety issues with it. Could say the same thing about the vaccine. Not everything that comes from Russia needs to be terrible, only the Putin.
column12: It is, have you been on public transport lately? I would believe it when I see death rates from the vaccines. So far, there are so many more deaths from COVID, do you think it was those 3 billionaires who sponsored it too?
column13: I have a strong view of people claiming something GMO is automatically negative. there really is NO proof that is the case. I do not know enough about the structure of vaccines to argue here, but even if they are classed as GMO, what exactly is wrong with that?
column14: The vaccines have been extremely beneficial and reduced levels of COVID across the world. How is supporting something that has proven effective "siding" with someone? Worldwide collaboration is what we need to fight the pandemic.
column15: All clear, some tweets were tricky especially those with surnames (had to google the first one)
